coding_practice.title: Partition Array into Disjoint Intervals
coding_practice.description:
Given an integer array nums, partition it into two (contiguous) subarrays left and right so that:
Every element in left is less than or equal to every element in right.
left and right are non-empty.
left has the smallest possible size.
Return the length of left after such a partitioning.
Test cases are generated such that partitioning exists.
coding_practice.constraints:
2 <= nums.length <= 10^5
0 <= nums[i] <= 10^6
There is at least one valid answer for the given input.
coding_practice.explanation:
1. 建立 left_max 陣列，儲存從左到右的最大值。
2. 建立 right_min 陣列，儲存從右到左的最小值。
3. 遍歷陣列，找到第一個位置 i，使 left_max[i] <= right_min[i+1]，此時 i+1 即為 left 的最小長度。
4. 回傳 i+1。
